alert.note: Alert for Cape Decision to Salisbury Sound Coastal Area; Cape Fairweather to Cape Suckling Coastal Area; Dixon Entrance to Cape Decision Coastal Area; Eastern Baranof Island and Southern Admiralty Island; Eastern Chichagof Island; Glacier Bay; Haines Borough and Lynn Canal; Inner Channels from Kupreanof Island to Etolin Island; Juneau Borough and Northern Admiralty Island; Misty Fjords; Salisbury Sound to Cape Fairweather Coastal Area; Southern Inner Channels; Taiya Inlet and Klondike Highway (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 06 at 2:55PM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...RAIN AND HIGH FREEZING LEVELS TO FOLLOW SIGNIFICANT WEEKEND WINTER STORM... There is high confidence in an abrupt pattern shift with rain and warmer temperatures next week following a significant winter storm that will likely drop more heavy snow across our region. Winter storm watches have been issued for heavy snow amounts across Southeast Alaska. As snow transitions to rain or even heavy rain late Sunday into Monday, conditions will worsen, become very slippery, and promote significant ponding. Additional heavy snow on top of already deep snowpack on roof-tops and other structures, boats, and aircraft could become heavier as rain- soaked snow challenges load capability. Rain in higher terrain and higher freezing levels could also lead to a risk of flooding into next week. Finally, we are also concerned with an abrupt rise in temperatures and freezing levels. This could mean an increased risk of avalanches near steep terrain. Please stay tuned to www.weather.gov or NOAA Weather radio for updates on this situation.
